title: Movement of bottom end of rod as it falls

content.question: The uniform rod of length L shown above is supported by holding end X so that the rod makes an angle 60Â° with the horizontal floor. There is no friction acting between the rod and the floor. When the support at X is removed, the rod falls under the influence of gravity. Which of the following best describes the movement of end Y as the rod falls?

choices.label: It moves <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AE0@</annotation> </semantics> </math> L to the left.

It moves <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AE2@</annotation> </semantics> </math> L to the right.

It moves <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AE0@</annotation> </semantics> </math> L to the right.

It moves <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>3</mn> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AE4@</annotation> </semantics> </math> L to the right.

content.answer: It moves <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AE2@</annotation> </semantics> </math> L to the right.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
